Title: Security update for Linux Kernel Live Patch 17 for SLE 12 SP1

Notes.Text: Security update for Linux Kernel Live Patch 17 for SLE 12 SP1
Notes.Title: Topic

Notes.Text:
This update for the Linux Kernel 3.12.74-60_64_48 fixes one issue.

The following security bugs were fixed:

- CVE-2017-15274: security/keys/keyctl.c in the Linux kernel did not consider the case of a NULL payload in conjunction with a nonzero length value, which allowed local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and OOPS) via a crafted add_key or keyctl system call (bsc#1045327).
- CVE-2017-1000251: The native Bluetooth stack in the Linux Kernel (BlueZ) was vulnerable to a stack overflow vulnerability in the processing of L2CAP configuration responses resulting in Remote code execution in kernel space (bsc#1057950).
Notes.Title: Details

Vulnerabilities.Description: The native Bluetooth stack in the Linux Kernel (BlueZ), starting at the Linux kernel version 2.6.32 and up to and including 4.13.1, are vulnerable to a stack overflow vulnerability in the processing of L2CAP configuration responses resulting in Remote code execution in kernel space.

SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP1:kgraft-patch-3_12_74-60_64_48-xen-4-4.1

Vulnerabilities.Description: security/keys/keyctl.c in the Linux kernel before 4.11.5 does not consider the case of a NULL payload in conjunction with a nonzero length value, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and OOPS) via a crafted add_key or keyctl system call, a different vulnerability than CVE-2017-12192.
